Thus, the depth of the great earth is 200 million li.
Next, there is moisture, also 200 million li deep.

Below, there is an infinite great wind that supports the heaven and earth and prevents them from tilting or moving.
The great earth is the beam and pillar of heaven.
Why is it so?
All the myriad things in the world depend on the earth.
The rivers, great seas, small seas, ponds, wells, valleys, grasses, trees, forests, medicinal herbs, and plants all grow and flourish on the earth.
Earth mountains, hill mountains, small iron enclosure mountains, Mount Sumeru, diamond mountains, and so on.
All these various wonderful jeweled mountains are the kings among mountains.
The four treasures emerge and rise above all the wonderful jeweled mountains.
They all emerge from the great earth and are formed together with precious treasures.
Moreover, Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, is formed from the four treasures and rises above all the worlds.

Mount Sumeru is where the heavenly lord and the four world guardians rely and reside.
What is to the south of Mount Sumeru? There are immeasurable palaces made of the seven treasures.
